candidates.title: libsql: final prep for libsql release
libsql: add cargo toml info for replication crate
libsql-sys: bring back unix-excl-vfs feature
candidates.body:
It forces the unix-excl VFS to be used for connections, which makes the library work in environments without shared memory or file locks.

Fixes #833

candidates.title: Measure replication latencies
candidates.body:
This PR add monitoring of replication latencies. We measure the time between a transaction being commited on the primary, and the commit frame received by the replica. To do that, the logger keeps track of the latest 100 commits timestamps for a database and sends the timestamps to the replicas through the replication protocol.

The first few commits are unrelated and just fix broken stuff on the repo

candidates.title: drop Cargo.lock
candidates.body: It's already in .gitignore, so let's check it out of .git

candidates.title: fix missing commit frame on local_client inject from snapshot
candidates.body:
This PR fixes a bug with libsql local client injection from snapshot file. In sqld, snapshots are often only partially applied, so all frames in the snaphot have a size_after set to 0. When the server streams the pages, it sets the size_after on the last frame it sends. This wasn't propagated to the local client implementation.

This PR fixes this issue, and adds a regression test.

candidates.title: fix(libsql): fix `remote` feature to not build sys
Fix blocking ResultBuilder in WriteProxy
candidates.body: The QueryBuilder was being misused (by me) in the `WriteProxy` code. This fixes it by driving the query builder in on the thread pool.

candidates.title: Migrate from bytemuck to zerocopy
candidates.body: zerocopy handles endianess, which was required for sqlite, and is overall more robust.

candidates.title: Libsql cursor
candidates.body:
WIP

This PR adds a support for cursors in Hrana HTTP client. Cursors enable to fetch rows and batch results on demand, without requiring to prefetch (potentially large) result sets in memory. This is done by:
1. Splitting `HttpSend` trait response into buffered and streamed one.
2. Introducing cursor data structure capable of patching streamed response into series of protocol messages:
    - These messages are then organised into streams of cursor steps (each step matches an input batch request result set).
    - Further cursor steps organise streams of subsequent entries into start/end step metadata and stream of rows.

PS: atm. cursor API is replacing existing execute/execute_batch statement in HranaStream without any profound changes in the upper libsql client API. It does so by calling a cursor API and then buffering it into memory and converting it into `BatchResult` which is a well-understood libsql client structure. Therefore event though it's used underneath and tested, the advantages of using it are none, as currently the upper layer of libsql client API - which is shared between local SQLite, embedded replicas and Hrana - has no means to represent a streamed content.

candidates.title: Store replication index in Page 1
candidates.body:
Until this PR, the replication index was stored in two places:
- In the shadow wal header on a primary
- In the `client_wal_meta` on a replication

Thsi was problematic because, on the replica it forces us to inject a transaction at a time and sync the meta file on each injection, and on the primary, it forces us to recover the database from scratch when we loose the shadow wal.

To fix that, we we now store the replication index in the sqlite file header, in the top 8 bytes of the reserved bytes available in the header. On checkpoint, the most recent version of page 1 is patched with the new replication index, before being re-injected in the wal, and then checkpointed.

candidates.title: libsql-server: use LRU cache to store active namespaces
candidates.body:
This is a port of Marin's https://github.com/libsql/sqld/pull/689

This PR replaces the namespace store dumb hashmap with an LRU cache to bound the maximum number of namespaces loaded into memory while unbounding the number of namespaces allocated on a sqld instance. Additionally, this enables fully concurrent access to namespaces by removing the global lock on the namespace store.

candidates.title: sqld: add in process s3 for bottomless tests
candidates.body: This adds in process mock s3 backend via the `s3s` crate. This allows us to run tests without requiring a user run `minio` or hook up their real aws account.

candidates.title: cargo-dist: handle releases
candidates.body: Instead of appending to releases from release drafter, let cargo-dist take care of creating releases.

candidates.title: remove useless protobuf gen in libsql
libsql: fix for rust-cache
candidates.body: The rust-cache GitHub action uses a TOML parser which chokes on the extra space before the comma in one line of this `Cargo.toml`. While it's actually valid syntax, just removing the extra comma should fix running the job.

candidates.title: wasi: refactor to libsql-wasi crate
candidates.body: The crate still has a main.rs file for demo purposes, but the logic is extracted to a library.

candidates.title: Support compiling libSQL to Wasm with virtual WAL
candidates.body:
This PR contains a demo which uses Wasmtime runtime to run libSQL in a WebAssembly instance, compiled in WAL mode. Right now it's full of stubs, and a VFS that calls back to the host for each operation. Once these stubs are implemented **and** we also provide a virtual WAL implementation that calls back to the host, we'll have a solid foundation for running libSQL with replication as a Wasm instance.

Step 1: compile `libsql.wasm` (should be automated with build.rs, I'm just lazy)
```sh
cd libsql-sqlite3
make wasi
```
Step 2: run the demo
```sh
cd ext/libsql-wasi-demo
RUST_LOG=info,libsql_wasi_demo=trace cargo run
```
Step 3: profit
```sh
$ file /tmp/wasm-demo.db*
/tmp/wasm-demo.db:     SQLite 3.x database, last written using SQLite version 3044000, writer version 2, read version 2, file counter 1, database pages 1, cookie 0, schema 0, unknown 0 encoding, version-valid-for 1
/tmp/wasm-demo.db-wal: empty
$ sqlite3 /tmp/wasm-demo.db "pragma journal_mode"
wal
```

Virtual WAL is not implemented in this patch, **but** this demo already successfully used WAL mode from a WebAssembly instance and created a WAL.

Next steps (arbitrary order):
1. forge this demo into a library we can later use to run libsql Wasm instances for users
2. add virtual WAL support
